Dear Ms. Waidelich:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/11/24, youth asked staff member a question and the staff
member responded with derogatory language.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1/ Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on
February 14, 2024. Staff 1 reported she was present when Staff 2
stated “Shut the fuck up talking to me” to Youth A. She reported this
occurred when the youth asked about breakfast. Staff 1 reported
Staff 2 was having a hard day with another youth and reacted poorly
towards Youth A. She reported she comforted Youth A after the
situation occurred. Youth A reported to Staff 1 that it was okay
because Staff 2 always talks to him like that. She reported there was
no other youth around when this occurred. Staff 1 reported Staff 3
and Staff 4 were also working that day but is unsure if they heard it or
not. Staff 1 reported staff are trained they are to use positive
language around the youth and to never use swear words.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
14, 2024. Youth A reported he likes living at the facility and likes
most of the staff members there. He reported that he does not like
Staff 2 because he cussed him out. When asked to explain more,
Youth A reported it was a few weeks ago during breakfast time and
Youth A was trying to joke around with Staff 2. He reported he does
not remember specifically what Staff 2 said but does remember Staff
2 telling him, “Fuck You.” Youth A reported staff are not allowed to
talk to youth like that. He reported Staff 2 will constantly tell Youth A
to leave him alone and not talk to him. Youth A reported he tries to
stay away from Staff 2. He reported when Staff 2 swore at him, there
was no other youth around but believed Staff 1 or Staff 3 was there.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
14, 2024. Chief Administrator was present during the interview.
2

Staff 2 reported Youth A does not like him because he always
challenges Youth A to do better. He reported Youth A will make
comments about how he does not like Staff 2 and will say “Eww Staff
2 is working over here.” Staff 2 reported he is one of the main staff
that will redirect Youth A’s negative behaviors. Staff 2 reported he
has never said anything hurtful to Youth A or swore at Youth A. He
reported Staff 1 has made a comment that he has sworn at Youth A
but that is not true. Staff 2 explained a few weeks ago, back in
January, he was walking across the pod to the cafeteria and while he
was walking, he was singing a song out loud. Staff 2 reported he did
sing the lyrics “fuck you” but it was not toward anyone. He reported
he was not listening to any music at the time, but it was just a song in
his head. Staff 2 reported he did not think anyone heard it and he
knows he should not be saying swear words around the youth. He
denied the allegations of swearing directly at Youth A and Youth A
never came up to talk to him that day. Staff 2 reported the staff are
trained to never swear or use degrading language towards the youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
14, 2024. Chief Administrator was present during the interview.
Staff 3 reported she has never heard staff swear directly at a youth.
She reported if she was to hear that happen, she would be reporting
it immediately. She stated that she was working on January 11,
2024, and remembers Staff 1 asking her if she heard what Staff 2
had just said to Youth A. Staff 3 reported she does not remember
hearing any swearing and does not even remember Staff 2 and
Youth A having interactions because she was focused on the direct
youth that she was working with. She reported she does remember
Staff 2 walking through the unit but that is all she remembers.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on February 21, 2024. Staff 4
reported she was working on January 11, 2024, but could not
remember who was exactly working that day. She stated she does
remember hearing Staff 2 state, “Shut the fuck up talking to me.”
Staff 4 reported she does believe that was towards a youth and
stated Staff 2 was just walking by when it occurred. She stated Youth
A was not near Staff 2 when he stated it.
Documents Reviewed:
- Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment
Discipline Policy- Facility prohibits all cruel and severe
discipline including verbal abuse, ridicule, or humiliation.
- Staff 2’s Human Resource File- Staff 2 has no disciplinary
actions of having negative interactions with the youth or
causing them harm. He does have disciplinary actions due to
attendance and completing documentation. Staff 2 is up to
3

date with all his required training and completed trauma
informed care on 12/07/2023.
Analysis Facility is found in non-compliance of this rule. Staff 1 and Youth A
both reported Staff 2 swore directly at Youth A when he asked him
a question. Staff 3 reported was not able to hear anything and
Staff 4 reported she heard Staff 2 swear but was not sure who it
was to, she did not believe it was Youth A but was not sure. Staff
2 admitting to swearing while working but it was not directed
toward a youth.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 did not follow the internal policy of reporting the incident
timely.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on February 14, 2024. Staff 1
reported she heard Staff 2 tell Youth A “Shut the fuck up talking to
me.” She reported she told Supervisor after this happened and he
stated that Staff 2’s supervisor was working with Staff 2 already. Staff
1 reported she was never told she needed to make a report. She
reported she has been dwelling on this situation for a while now and
is just reporting it now because she was worried that someone could
get fired. Staff 1 reported she knows she should have reported it
sooner. She reported she never talked to Program Manager about
this situation until yesterday, February 13, 2024.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 14, 2024. Chief Administrator was present. Supervisor
reported Staff 1 did tell Supervisor about the concerns of Staff 2
swearing at Youth A. He reported he told Staff 1 that she would need
to report these concerns. Supervisor reported he did not follow his
own protocol call of telling Program Manager about the situation.
4

Program Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 4, 2024. Chief Administrator was present. Program
Manager reported the first time he heard of these allegations was on
February 13, 2024. He reported he was the one to tell staff that this
needed to be called in for an investigation. Program Manager
reported staff are trained to call in any concerns of abuse and neglect
right away and they should let himself and their supervisor know of
the situation.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
14, 2024. Chief Administrator was present for this interview.
Staff 3 reported on January 11, 2024, Staff 1 did come up to her to
ask if she heard Staff 2 swear at Youth A. She reported she did not
hear anything because she was focused on working with another
youth. Staff 3 reported if she heard any staff directly at youth, she
would report this right away to upper management and call in a
complaint immediately. She reported every two weeks at the team
meeting, upper management reviews all of the facilities policies and
the importance of reporting any abuse or neglect.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on February 21, 2024. Staff 4
reported if she ever heard a staff member swear at a youth, she
would immediately report it to management. She reported staff are
trained to tell a supervisor or Program Manager of any concerns
about another staff’s performance around the youth.
Documentation Reviewed:
- Facility tips for Reporting Adverse/Critical Events- This
protocol notes that staff are responsible and must report any
adverse/ critical events. One example listed within the
protocol is, “An incident that results in an injury or physical or
emotional harm to self or others”. Staff are to immediately
make notification to the Program Manager who will have
coordinate with staff on the next steps. Staff are to also
complete an incident report by the end of their shift.
- Facility Incident Report dated 02/13/2024- Incident report
was the report of the concerns Staff 1 had about Staff 2
swearing at Youth A on 01/11/2024. The incident report was
completed on 02/13/2024.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 does not have any
disciplinary actions causing harm to the youth or not reporting
abuse or neglect of a youth. Staff 1 does have disciplinary
actions due to not completing her training hours timely,
attendance, not following the safety plan and speeding. Staff 1
completed incident report training on 12/21/2023 and
mandated reporting training on 02/08/2022.
5

Analysis Facility is found in violation as Staff 1 did follow the incident
reporting procedures about the concerns of Staff 2 swearing at
Youth A. It is noted that staff are to report immediately to Program
Manager and complete an incident report at the end of their shift
when they have a concerning incident occur. Staff 1 admitted she
did not follow the protocol.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
